rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has unit
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Unit, added due to data import

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Region of operation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The supply of suitable external dc voltage is called as biasing. Either forward or reverse biasing is done to the emitter and collector junctions of the transistor. These biasing methods make the transistor circuit to work in four kinds of regions such as Active region, Saturation region, Cutoff region and Inverse active region.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Workshop
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The overall organizational working structures within the fabs is described in the entity “Workshop”.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Depletion mode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A transistor that is normally closed (on), allowing current to pass, but is triggered to open (off) and impede current. Contrast with "enhancement mode", wherein the transistor is normally open (off), but is triggered to close (on).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has equipment group
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This property is used to relate operations with the equipment groups that perform them.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has route
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This property is used to relate operations with their routes and simulation routes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has rework probability lots
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Operation: Probability of rework-tested full lots to be reworked.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Chemical polishing
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The chemical polishing process or chemical mechanical planarization (CMP) is a process whereby a chemical reaction increases the mechanical removal rate of a material. CMP is commonly used to polish off high spots on wafers or films deposited on wafers, flattening the film or wafer, referred to as planarization. The chemical reaction that increases the mechanical removal rate is commonly tailored to provide a higher removal rate of one material versus another material. The chemical action in CMP helps to achieve higher selectivity's of one material to another than a strictly mechanical process would provide.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Operating range
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes normal OperatingProperties of a System under some specified Conditions. For example, to the power requirement or maintenance schedule of a System under a specified temperature range. In the absence of OperatingProperties, it simply describes the Conditions in which a System is expected to operate.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Sputtering
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The sputtering process, or physical vapor deposition (PVD) is the most used layering process today. Here gas atoms, mostly argon, strike out atoms from the cathode I an electric field which then form a thin film on the wafer surface.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Dry etching
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Dry etching is a process whereby etching is accomplished by a reactive gas as opposed to a liquid. Dry etching techniques include plasma etch, reactive ion etch, magnetically enhanced reactive ion etch, inductively coupled plasma, electron spin resonance, etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has P time per unit
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in seconds

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has technology
This property is used to relate operations with their associated equipment and technologies.
has technology
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Name of the technology

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has scrapping test
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Operation: Are the processed lots tested for scrapping?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has operation critical
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Operation: Is the Operation critical in terms of SC planning (a Bottleneck) or not?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Route
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The master entity “Route” describes the structure of a workflow out of operations. Every product uses a specific route in its value stream, i.e. the complete sequence of operations with all mandatory and optional operations necessary to complete the product. A route makes use of the single operations. (workflow descriptive master entity).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Saturation region
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This is the region in which transistor tends to behave as a closed switch. The transistor has the effect of its collector and Emitter being shorted. The collector and Emitter currents are maximum in this mode of operation.

The 'Operation' ontology module represents information about operations: combination of activities necessary to permit an installation to function. The represented operations include switching, controlling, monitoring and maintenance as well as any work activities.
rdf:Description.terms:creator: Javier Cuenca <mailto:jcuenca@mondragon.edu> Felix Larrinaga <mailto:flarrinaga@mondragon.edu>
rdf:Description.dc:title: Operation ontology

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Simulation part
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A simulation part helps to identify the same product in different locations. They are visible in Product Structures. This is a simulation entity and not a form of production/planning.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has lot size quantity
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Lot Size: Standard (FE) or optimal (BE) lot size for respective PL3

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Operation mode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An operational situation/configuration of a system characterized by its active functions. Inside an operational mode the system can perform specific operational scenarios, and so activate the corresponding functions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Diffusion
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Diffusion is a process whereby a substance redistributes from an area of relatively high concentration to an area of relatively low concentration due to random thermal motion. The larger the concentration gradient the faster diffusion occurs for a given temperature, conversely, the higher the temperature the faster diffusion occurs for a given concentration gradient.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Event calendar
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An event calendar is an organized way to show the upcoming events based on calendar dates.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has mean time to failure distribution
has operation ID
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Operation identifier

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Lithography
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The lithography process is the key process in frontend. This consists of the following steps: a photo resisting layer is spun on a wafer, then exposed through the mask, then developed, then showing the effect on the open places, and then final deletion of the photo resisting material leaves only the remaining structure on the water. after some time for deposition, these steps are repeated up to 35 times.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Wet etching
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Wet Etching is the process of removing material-etching, through the use of chemical activity.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Time constraints
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: As single operations can set the lot to a time-critical state, time constraints can ensure that the operation setting it to an uncritical state is not delayed. Also the other case where certain time has to be spent between two operations can be covered with this master entity. (workflow deswcriptive master entities).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Operation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The master entity “Operation” depicts the generic behavior of a single process step. Each operation has a foreign key relation to equipment and to route which means that the operation is required by the specific routes and requires a specific equipment. (workflow descriptive master entity).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has rework probability wafers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Operation: Probability of rework-tested wafers to be reworked.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has operating property
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Relation from an OperatingRange of a System to an OperatingProperty describing the operating range of the System.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has current WIP
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This property is used to relate operations with their current WIP.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has split lots
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Split into # lots, added due to data import

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has event calendar
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This property is used to relate operations with their event calendar.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Technology
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A semiconductor technology is a set of equipment, processes, manufacturing techniques and the related methods and procedures to enable the design & production of components, sub-components and modules.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has supply chain id
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Assignment of technology to supply chain.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has sequence number
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Lot Event: FK; Sequential number of the operation lot has entered

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has demand
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This property is used to relate operations with redundant demands and production requests.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Operating property
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This class is used to represent operation and configuration aspects of devices.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has time constraints
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This class is used to relate operations with their time constraints.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Current WIP
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: “Current WIP” entity describes the actual material distribution in the supply chain.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has operation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This property is used to relate different entities (such as equipment) the the operations they perform.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Simulation route
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A simulation route (AKA workroute) represents a sequence of process steps in manufacutring (mainly at wafer fab). This is a simulation entity and not a form of production/planning.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Product level
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: In the "product level" entity, the aggregation of elements enables the grouping of products and defines the relationship between products and groups at different hierarchy levels. This supports planning, logistics, modeling, forecasting and reporting.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has capacity loss
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Calendar: Facility capacity loss in percent.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has sampling rate
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sampling Rate: Execution rate of operation If operation is mandatory sampling rate is 1 (1- sampling rate = skipping rate of optional operation)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has lot size
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This property is used to relate operations with their lot size

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has scrapping probability lots
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Operation: Probability of scrapping-tested full lots to be scrapped.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has rework operation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Rework Operation, if needed.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has split lot chips
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Split into lots with # chips, added due to data import

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Enhancement mode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A transistor that is normally open (off), but is triggered to close (on).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has mean time to repair distribution
has rework test
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Operation: Are the processed lots tested for rework?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has route name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Name of route (usually equals product names requiring the route).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Production requests
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Production requests definte what the facilities need to produce when and in what quantity.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Deposition
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The deposition process, or chemical vapor deposition (CVD) is a process whereby a fiolm is deposited by reacting chemicals together in the gaseous or vapor phase to form a film. The gases or vapors utilized for CVD are compounds that contain the element to be deposited and that may be inducted to react with a substrate or other gas(es) to deposit a film. The CVD reactoin may be thermally activated, plasma induced, plasma enhanced CVD or activated by light in photon induced CVD.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has scrapping probability wafers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Operation: Probability of scrapping-tested wafers to be scrapped.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Threshold voltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The threshold voltage, commonly abbreviated as Vth, of a field-effect transistor (FET) is the minimum gate-to-source voltage VGS (th) that is needed to create a conducting path between the source and drain terminals. It is an important scaling factor to maintain power efficiency.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has equipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Property used to relate operations with the equipment that perform them.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Lot size
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A measure or quantity increment acceptable to or specified by the party offering to buy or sell. Used also as an alternative term for lot quantity.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has mean time to repair
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in seconds

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has event calendar type
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Event Calendar: Type of event

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has workshop
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This class is used to relate operations with their related working structures.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has mean time to failure
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in seconds

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Demand snapshot
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The “Demand” entity stores redundant demand at every product level.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has variance p time
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in seconds

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Implantation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Implantation or Ion Implantation is a technique where ions are accelerated to a higher energy and speed an injected into a semiconductor. The dominant techniques for introducing dopants into a semiconductor.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has operation name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Name of the operation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Switching frequency
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: In electronics, switching frequency refers to the rate at which an electronic switch performs its function.
